description: Brett Kavanaugh’s confirmation vote, barring delays caused by allegations of sexual assault, is scheduled for Sept. 20. What’s at stake for you?
title: Young Americans, What Do You Think About the Kavanaugh Confirmation?
title_page: Opinion | Young Americans, What Do You Think About the Kavanaugh Confirmation? - The New York Times
text:
In response to a recent editorial, “Confirmed: Brett Kavanaugh Can’t Be Trusted,” about the Supreme Court nominee, Brandon from Harrisburg, Pa., a reader, commented on the dangers of confirming a candidate chosen by the current administration. “At such a tumultuous moment in our country,” he wrote, “red flags emerge as the president is in the midst of an impending crisis — one that could alter the future of our nation’s fabric forever.”
He also worried about the long-term repercussions, including the possible overturning of landmark decisions like Roe v. Wade. “On paper, he would fit the mold of what a Supreme Court justice should be,” Brandon continued. “But in reality, we have a man who would likely politically polarize the court and put the country on a path backward, and that scares me.”
He added, “I am a young American, and I want to know what my future entails by raising Judge Kavanaugh to the Supreme Court.”
